turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Rifle grenade.
turn.1: What were the main types of grenades used in the Second Sino-Japanese War?
turn.2: The spigot-type grenade launchers were used by Japanese Special Naval Landing Forces to launch an anti-tank (hollow-charge) finned grenade.
turn.3: What were the different types of grenades used on land?
turn.4: They were also used to propel Type 91 hand grenades fitted with tail-fin assemblies.
turn.5: What were the different types of ammunition used in the war?
turn.6: These grenades had wood-bulleted launching cartridges stored in their tail-fin assemblies.
turn.8: The cartridges are fired from the rifle and the wooden bullets are trapped by the tail-fin assemblies launching and arming the grenades.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: These launchers are not numbered, and production figures are not available and examples of spigot grenade launchers are rarely encountered.
turn.11: Did they have any other types of grenades?
turn.12: In 1939, the Japanese introduced the Type 89 grenade discharger, the Type 91 fragmentation grenade was fitted with a propellant base and time fuse.
